DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term for the procedure(s) used to confirm a disease diagnosis.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Pathologic Confirmation Method
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology._Having been established or verified._A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A disease is any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. Sometimes the term is used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function. (from Wikipedia)

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

ObjectClass.changeDescription: Updated to add EVS concept preferred name. dw

Property.preferredDefinition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:Having been established or verified.:A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
A means, manner of procedure, or systematic course of actions that have to be performed in order to accomplish a particular goal.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 8/7/17 tt DEC released; transferred context and added CSI, registration status per Round 5 finalization task.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.: The light microscopic study of normal and abnormal cells in fine needle aspirates (FNAs), body cavity fluids, and smears.: Having been established or verified.

Concepts.definition: Pertaining to the combined microscopic physical features of cells and their surrounding extracellular environment in tissues.
The light microscopic study of normal and abnormal cells in fine needle aspirates (FNAs), body cavity fluids, and smears.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Technique or procedure used for the study of the microanatomy of tissues and their cellular structure; usually involves microscopic examination of tissue slices.

Concepts.definition: Technique or procedure used for the study of the microanatomy of tissues and their cellular structure; usually involves microscopic examination of tissue slices.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features.

Concepts.definition: Technique or procedure for manipulation of cells and analysis of cell properties and subcellular features.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
